question: 施行
sourceMnemonic: When you <kanji>go</kanji> to <kanji>carry out</kanji> something, you are <vocabulary>carrying out</vocabulary> whatever it is. In a legal context, if you carry something out, such as a law, then it's known as <vocabulary>enforcement</vocabulary>.
sourceReadingMnemonic: This is a jukugo word, which usually means on'yomi readings from the kanji. If you know the readings of your kanji you'll know how to read this as well. An alternative reading is <ja>せこう</ja>, which is more often used by legal professionals.
